sourceDocument.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml
sourceDocument.title: Practical Data: Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store

requirements.statement: This document is part of a series proposing a target reference architecture for Data Governance at scale for large organizations with fragmented business processes and data flows, and provides a deeper dive into an architectural component.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:This document forms part of a series proposing a target reference architecture

references.quote: This document forms part of a series proposing a target reference architecture for Data Governance at scale for large organizations with highly fragmented business processes and data flows...

requirements.statement: Within each document section, the document covers metadata data model design and functional capability design, and provides links to other documents in the series.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Within each document section we cover Metadata Data Model design

references.quote: Within each document section we cover Metadata Data Model design and the functional Capability design. Links to other documents in this series can also be found below.

requirements.statement: The Data Inventory Capability must enable the collection and management of technical and business inventory data elements across the organization.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:The Data Inventory Capability enables the collection and management

references.quote: The Data Inventory Capability enables the collection and management of the technical and business inventory data elements across the organisation.

requirements.statement: Data Inventory information is the most fundamental information about data storage and flows within the organization and serves as the basis for other aspects of data governance, including lineage and quality.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data Inventory information forms the most fundamental information collated

references.quote: Data Inventory information forms the most fundamental information collated about the data storage and flows within the organization, and serves as the basis for all other aspects of data governance, including Lineage and Quality.

requirements.statement: Data Inventory capabilities must be able to scan and inventory systemic and business data elements and store them in the Data Governance Metadata store.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:provide the ability to scan and inventory all systemic

references.quote: Data Inventory capabilities provide the ability to scan and inventory all systemic and business data elements, storing them in the Data Governance Metadata store.

requirements.statement: At a minimum, Data Inventory discovery enables the collection of data elements.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:at a minimum, Data Inventory discovery enables the collection

references.quote: While, at a minimum, Data Inventory discovery enables the collection of data elements...

requirements.statement: Additional Data Profiling capabilities can enable automated classification and description of data based on its content, where available.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data Profiling capabilities enable the automated classification

references.quote: ...additional Data Profiling capabilities enable the automated classification and description of data based on its content, where available.

requirements.statement: Data inventorying requires access to data structure information (for example, fields and schemas).

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data Inventorying requires access to the data structure information

references.quote: Note Data Inventorying requires access to the data structure information - i.e., fields and schemas etc

requirements.statement: Data profiling requires access to underlying data content.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:data profiling requires access to the underlying data content

references.quote: ...data profiling requires access to the underlying data content.

requirements.statement: The data model designs are for illustration and convenience only; although styled as a graph database with nodes and relationships, they do not require a specific data storage method, database technology, or implementation design.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data model designs are included for illustration purposes only

references.quote: Note: Data model designs are included for illustration purposes only and are styled as a graph database with nodes and relationships... does not necessitate a specific data storage method, database technology, or implementation design.

requirements.statement: Attribute is the lowest level of a technical data management hierarchy and represents the level at which data values are technically named, stored, and managed.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:define Attribute as the lowest level of a data management hierarchy

references.quote: ...we define Attribute as the lowest level of a data management hierarchy...

requirements.statement: Implementations may use any number of levels and alternative names for technical inventory hierarchy levels; the only mandatory level is attribute, where all data lineage relationships are defined.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:individual implementations may choose to include any number of levels

references.quote: ...individual implementations may choose to include any number of levels... The only mandatory level is at an attribute, where all data lineage relationships are defined.

requirements.title: Application definition
requirements.statement: Application (also known as a system) is the highest level of decomposition of a technical inventory of data elements.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:An Application (also known as a system) is defined as the highest level

references.quote: Application - An Application (also known as a system) is defined as the highest level of decomposition of a technical inventory of data elements.

requirements.title: Component definition
requirements.statement: Component describes a sub-component of an application (for example, a database).

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:A component describes a sub-component of an application

references.quote: Component - A component describes a sub-component of an application - ie, Database

requirements.title: Schema definition
requirements.statement: Schema is a logical subdivision of a component, often relating to a group of logical tables inside a database.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:A schema is a logical subdivision of a component

references.quote: Schema - A schema is a logical subdivision of a component, often relating to an individual group of logical tables inside a database

requirements.title: Table definition
requirements.statement: Table is a logical grouping of related attributes associated with an individual record.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:A table is defined as a logical grouping of related attributes

references.quote: Table - A table is defined as a logical grouping of related attributes, all associated with an individual record

requirements.title: Attribute definition (hierarchy item)
requirements.statement: Attribute is the lowest level of a technical hierarchy and represents the point at which data values are stored and managed.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:An attribute is the lowest level of a technical hierarchy

references.quote: Attribute - An attribute is the lowest level of a technical hierarchy, which represents the point at which data values are stored and managed

requirements.statement: Element is the lowest level of the business data management hierarchy and represents the level at which the business understands how the data is named and used.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:We define ELEMENT as the lowest level of the business data management hierarchy

references.quote: We define ELEMENT as the lowest level of the business data management hierarchy...

requirements.statement: Implementations may use any number of levels and alternative names for business inventory hierarchy levels.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:individual implementations may choose to include any number of levels

references.quote: ...individual implementations may choose to include any number of levels within the business inventory and leverage alternative names for these levels.

requirements.title: Domain definition
requirements.statement: Domain is the highest level at which business data is defined and owned.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:A domain describes the highest level at which business data is defined

references.quote: Domain - A domain describes the highest level at which business data is defined and owned

requirements.title: Class definition
requirements.statement: Class (or object) is the highest level at which the business understands a complete data object.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:A class (or object) is the highest level that the business understands

references.quote: Class - A class (or object) is the highest level that the business understands a complete data object

requirements.title: (Sub)Class definition
requirements.statement: (Sub)Class is the next level of breakdown of a complete business object and represents a logical grouping of business elements; organizations may allow multiple subclass depths.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:A subclass is the next level of breakdown of a complete business object

references.quote: (Sub)Class - A subclass is the next level of breakdown of a complete business object and represents a logical grouping of business elements. Some organizations may allow several depths of subclasses.

requirements.title: Element definition (hierarchy item)
requirements.statement: Element is the lowest level of the business hierarchy and represents the point at which the business understands the data value.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:An element is the lowest level of the business hierarchy

references.quote: Element - An element is the lowest level of the business hierarchy, representing the point at which the data understands the data value

requirements.statement: The business-logical model connects to the technical model at the lowest levels: most business attributes relate to a single technical attribute; a single business attribute may relate to multiple technical attributes; the reverse (one technical attribute relating to multiple business attributes) is not valid.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

headingPath: Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store
locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Most Business Attributes relate to a single Technical attribute

references.quote: Most Business Attributes relate to a single Technical attribute; however... we allow a single business attribute to relate to multiple technical attributes. However, the reverse is not valid

requirements.statement: For INVENTORY/ATTRIBUTE nodes in the Data Governance Metadata Repository, the nodeID field is the unique ID of the node within the repository.

references.quote: The (derived) fully qualified unique name of the node within the technical hierarchy. Derived from top to bottom. For example, ApplicationName/ComponentName/... SchemaName/TableName/AttributeName

requirements.statement: An example nodeFQName is crm/database/People/person-details/lastname.

requirements.statement: The Data Inventory Capability must collect the technical and physical inventory of all data elements across the organization.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:is responsible for collecting the technical and physical inventory

references.quote: The Data Inventory Capability is responsible for collecting the technical and physical inventory of all data elements across the organization.

requirements.statement: Given the scale of inventory information, the majority of inventory information is expected to be discovered and updated automatically.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:we expect the vast majority of inventory information

references.quote: Given the scale of inventory information, we expect the vast majority of inventory information to be discovered and updated automatically.

requirements.statement: The Data Inventory Capability includes a Data Inventory Core Engine sub-component.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data Inventory Core Engine

references.quote: Data Inventory Core Engine

requirements.statement: The Data Inventory Core Engine must provide the logistical and control framework for individual connections, automatically discovering and maintaining inventory and profiling information within the Data Governance Metadata catalog.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:provides the logistical and control framework for individual connections

references.quote: The Data Inventory Core Engine provides the logistical and control framework for individual connections, automatically discovering and maintaining inventory and profiling information within the Data Governance Metadata catalog.

requirements.statement: The Data Inventory Capability includes Data Inventory Connectors.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data Inventory Connectors

references.quote: Data Inventory Connectors

requirements.statement: The Data Inventory Capability includes Data Profiling Connectors.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data Profiling Connectors

references.quote: Data Profiling Connectors

requirements.statement: Data Profiling Connectors provide the incremental ability to classify and categorize data based on its content.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:provide the incremental ability to classify and categorise data

references.quote: Data Profiling Connectors provide the incremental ability to classify and categorise data based on its content.

requirements.statement: Data profiling may be implemented as part of a Data Inventory connector or as a separate connector, depending on entitlements and architecture.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data profiling may be implemented as part of a Data Inventory connector

references.quote: Data profiling may be implemented as part of a Data Inventory connector or separate, depending on entitlements and architecture.

requirements.statement: Data profiling may occur at a field or record level.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:Data Profiling may occur at a field or record level

references.quote: Data Profiling may occur at a field or record level

requirements.statement: Data profiling can support identifying that content appears to relate to a person and contains PII information.

references.relativePath: confluence/DataModel-202833967-Practical Data- Data Governance At Scale - Data Inventory Capability and Metadata Store.xhtml

locator.textFingerprint: fingerprint:v1:this looks like a record about a person and contains PII information

openQuestions: For INVENTORY/ELEMENT nodes, what is the intended meaning/structure of nodeSpecification? The field appears in the table but its description is blank.
What behaviors and responsibilities are intended for 'Data Inventory Connectors'? The document lists the sub-component name but does not provide a description in this excerpt.
